glossdef.p:
Hard- and software assets consist of different constituents. These constituents are identified and determined based on various properties and representations. The term artifact is used as generalized term for the identification and tracking of these constituents. Artifacts are:
individual files identified in the file system
installed software consisting of several files and folders
software packages or archives which are can be obtained from a package manager a repository or registry
complete images of virtual machines, storage media or storage units
identified devices or parts (logical, software-defined or physical)

Artifacts have different properties depending on their kind (hardware/software) and representation, which are used for identification and differentiation. Artifacts are classified and documented here according to defined artifact types.
